intro: Coeloglossum viride f. parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered green helleborine, is a rare orchid species native to Europe. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and pale greenish-yellow flowers with a distinctive hooded lip. The plant is a terrestrial orchid that thrives in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and damp meadows. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is known for its delicate, fragrant blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
